column4: I've reinstalled windows and ubuntu on top of each other many times and haven't had a problem until today.
Ubuntu reports that the cable is unplugged. I don't see any flashing lights on the ethernet adapter.
means cable not recieving signal need a new Cat5 or ethernet cable...
I had windows 7 running perfectly this afternoon.
ur using ubuntu right???
i tried linux mint first and had this problem. I tried installing ubuntu and got the same result.
yes, I understand that
checked the make and model of network card for support???
what version of linux ubuntu are u running
is this the latest version have u done a ubuntu search forums to see if they report problem/????
good luck ...

read method 4 . but this would suggest enabling intergrated perpherals and sounds like a windows computer selling point making it impossible to load other OS due to a restart would reset the lan not to work...
already enabled on the bios. I think it's windows not shuting down the ethernet adapter properly, which explains why the light doesn't blink on bootup.
did u follow method 2 for driver related issue with wake on line device???
i've already installed ubuntu over windows
does the live cd work for ubuntu?  If so I would think it is a driver related issue...
i've already replaced the reltek 8169 that comes with the kernel with 8168 so i don't think so
the live cd works with no internet connection
* the live cd works, but has no internet connection

pin pointed out the Bios or Basic input out put is holding the nic in a wake on lan state and is looking for windows to wake the driver.... I hope the dont keep selling this motherboard I bet this board is not supported very well.. :( might want to fire over to archlinux and see what the community might be able to suggest to get ur device to turn...
lol, the mobo is discontinued, it's a gigabyte ma790x-ud4p I purchased 4 years ago
